get.description: The operation to list all exports at the given scope.

parameters.name: $expand
parameters.description: May be used to expand the properties within an export. Currently only 'runHistory' is supported and will return information for the last execution of each export.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: The operation to get the export for the defined scope by export name.

parameters.name: $expand
parameters.description: May be used to expand the properties within an export. Currently only 'runHistory' is supported and will return information for the last 10 executions of the export.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description: The operation to create or update a export. Update operation requires latest eTag to be set in the request. You may obtain the latest eTag by performing a get operation. Create operation does not require eTag.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters supplied to the CreateOrUpdate Export operation.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.description: The operation to delete a export.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: The operation to execute an export.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: The operation to get the execution history of an export for the defined scope and export name.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

ReportConfigDefinition.description: The definition of a report config.

type.description: The type of the report. Usage represents actual usage, forecast represents forecasted data and UsageAndForecast represents both usage and forecasted data. Actual usage and forecasted data can be differentiated based on dates.

timeframe.description: The time frame for pulling data for the report. If custom, then a specific time period must be provided.

timePeriod.description: Has time period for pulling data for the report.

dataset.description: Has definition for data in this report config.

ReportConfigTimePeriod.description: The start and end date for pulling data for the report.

from.description: The start date to pull data from.

to.description: The end date to pull data to.

ReportConfigDataset.description: The definition of data present in the report.

granularity.description: The granularity of rows in the report.

configuration.description: Has configuration information for the data in the report. The configuration will be ignored if aggregation and grouping are provided.

aggregation.description: Dictionary of aggregation expression to use in the report. The key of each item in the dictionary is the alias for the aggregated column. Report can have up to 2 aggregation clauses.

grouping.description: Array of group by expression to use in the report. Report can have up to 2 group by clauses.

sorting.description: Array of order by expression to use in the report.

filter.description: Has filter expression to use in the report.

ReportConfigDatasetConfiguration.description: The configuration of dataset in the report.

columns.description: Array of column names to be included in the report. Any valid report column name is allowed. If not provided, then report includes all columns.

ReportConfigAggregation.description: The aggregation expression to be used in the report.

name.description: The name of the column to aggregate.

function.description: The name of the aggregation function to use.

ReportConfigSorting.description: The order by expression to be used in the report.

name.description: The name of the column to sort.

ReportConfigGrouping.description: The group by expression to be used in the report.

type.description: Has type of the column to group.

name.description: The name of the column to group. This version supports subscription lowest possible grain.

ReportConfigFilter.description: The filter expression to be used in the report.

and.description: The logical "AND" expression. Must have at least 2 items.

or.description: The logical "OR" expression. Must have at least 2 items.

dimension.description: Has comparison expression for a dimension

tag.description: Has comparison expression for a tag

ReportConfigColumnType.description: The type of the column in the report.

ReportConfigComparisonExpression.description: The comparison expression to be used in the report.

name.description: The name of the column to use in comparison.

operator.description: The operator to use for comparison.

values.description: Array of values to use for comparison

ErrorResponse.description:
Error response indicates that the service is not able to process the incoming request. The reason is provided in the error message. 

Some Error responses: 

 * 429 TooManyRequests - Request is throttled. Retry after waiting for the time specified in the "x-ms-ratelimit-microsoft.consumption-retry-after" header. 

 * 503 ServiceUnavailable - Service is temporarily unavailable. Retry after waiting for the time specified in the "Retry-After" header.

message.description: Error message indicating why the operation failed.

eTag.description: eTag of the resource. To handle concurrent update scenario, this field will be used to determine whether the user is updating the latest version or not.

ExportListResult.description: Result of listing exports. It contains a list of available exports in the scope provided.

schedule.description: Has schedule information for the export.

CommonExportProperties.description: The common properties of the export.

format.description: The format of the export being delivered. Currently only 'Csv' is supported.

deliveryInfo.description: Has delivery information for the export.

definition.description: Has the definition for the export.

runHistory.description: If requested, has the most recent execution history for the export.

nextRunTimeEstimate.description: If the export has an active schedule, provides an estimate of the next execution time.

ExportSchedule.description: The schedule associated with the export.

status.description: The status of the export's schedule. If 'Inactive', the export's schedule is paused.

recurrencePeriod.description: Has start and end date of the recurrence. The start date must be in future. If present, the end date must be greater than start date.

ExportDeliveryInfo.description: The delivery information associated with a export.

destination.description: Has destination for the export being delivered.

ExportRecurrencePeriod.description: The start and end date for recurrence schedule.

ExportDeliveryDestination.description: The destination information for the delivery of the export. To allow access to a storage account, you must register the account's subscription with the Microsoft.CostManagementExports resource provider. This is required once per subscription. When creating an export in the Azure portal, it is done automatically, however API users need to register the subscription. For more information see https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-resource-manager/resource-manager-supported-services .

resourceId.description: The resource id of the storage account where exports will be delivered.

container.description: The name of the container where exports will be uploaded.

rootFolderPath.description: The name of the directory where exports will be uploaded.

type.description: The type of the export. Note that 'Usage' is equivalent to 'ActualCost' and is applicable to exports that do not yet provide data for charges or amortization for service reservations.

timeframe.description: The time frame for pulling data for the export. If custom, then a specific time period must be provided.

timePeriod.description: Has time period for pulling data for the export.

dataSet.description: The definition for data in the export.

ExportDataset.description: The definition for data in the export.

granularity.description: The granularity of rows in the export. Currently only 'Daily' is supported.

ExportDatasetConfiguration.description: The export dataset configuration. Allows columns to be selected for the export. If not provided then the export will include all available columns.

columns.description: Array of column names to be included in the export. If not provided then the export will include all available columns. The available columns can vary by customer channel (see examples).

ExportTimePeriod.description: The date range for data in the export. This should only be specified with timeFrame set to 'Custom'. The maximum date range is 3 months.

from.description: The start date for export data.

to.description: The end date for export data.

ExportExecutionListResult.description: Result of listing the execution history of an export.

ExportExecutionProperties.description: The properties of the export execution.

executionType.description: The type of the export execution.

status.description: The last known status of the export execution.

submittedBy.description: The identifier for the entity that executed the export. For OnDemand executions it is the user email. For scheduled executions it is 'System'.

submittedTime.description: The time when export was queued to be executed.

processingStartTime.description: The time when export was picked up to be executed.

processingEndTime.description: The time when the export execution finished.

fileName.description: The name of the exported file.

runSettings.description: The export settings that were in effect for this execution.

apiVersionParameter.name: api-version
apiVersionParameter.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request. The current version is 2020-06-01.

scopeExportParameter.name: scope
scopeExportParameter.description: The scope associated with export operations. This includes '/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/' for subscription scope, '/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}' for resourceGroup scope, '/providers/Microsoft.Billing/billingAccounts/{billingAccountId}' for Billing Account scope and '/providers/Microsoft.Billing/billingAccounts/{billingAccountId}/departments/{departmentId}' for Department scope, '/providers/Microsoft.Billing/billingAccounts/{billingAccountId}/enrollmentAccounts/{enrollmentAccountId}' for EnrollmentAccount scope, '/providers/Microsoft.Management/managementGroups/{managementGroupId} for Management Group scope, '/providers/Microsoft.Billing/billingAccounts/{billingAccountId}/billingProfiles/{billingProfileId}' for billingProfile scope, '/providers/Microsoft.Billing/billingAccounts/{billingAccountId}/billingProfiles/{billingProfileId}/invoiceSections/{invoiceSectionId}' for invoiceSection scope, and '/providers/Microsoft.Billing/billingAccounts/{billingAccountId}/customers/{customerId}' specific for partners.
